intro: Thymus aznavourii, commonly known as Armenian thyme, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm, with small, narrow leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pink to violet in color, forming dense clusters at the ends of the stems. This species is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
